definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: So, I want to apologize for flipping out before.
sentences.chinese: 我想對之前發神經的事向你道歉。

sentences.english: ‘This guy’s nuts,’ I can hear you saying.
sentences.chinese: “這傢伙發神經了吧，”我猜你肯定要這麼說。

sentences.english: Ralph really lost his mind after his wife left him.
sentences.chinese: 洛夫在他太太離開他後真的發神經了。

sentences.english: Last night, I got it again. Wanted to throw myself out of the window.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上，我又發神經了，想從窗戶上跳下去。

sentences.english: Don't have a cow! it's just a small bug.
sentences.chinese: 別發神經了，這只是一個小臭蟲。

definition: to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
